resources.string: Wrist Tweets, a Twitter notification plug-in for Sony Ericsson notifiers.\nFor: LiveView\nExtends:com.sonyericsson.extras.liveview

Wrist Tweets is a Twitter(tm) notification app for the Sony LiveView(tm).


Wrist Tweets does it's best to be a reliable Twitter notification app. It can monitor your timeline, mentions/@replies, direct messages, a Twitter list and will notify you of updates. Just enter the username, and optionally the name of the list you want to monitor
 Authentication is done using OAuth, so your password is never stored locally.
 By default, Wrist Tweets is smart about opening URLs and will open the first URL in a tweet when you press the LiveView action button, rather than just forwarding to the Twitter page.
 The Sony LiveView(tm) is innovative but buggy, and will often disconnect. This plugin can be set to check for updates each time the LiveView is reconnected - this way you are less likely to miss notifications. 

 About Twitter permissions: Although this app is only for receiving and not sending tweets, it requires Twitters "Read, Write and Access direct messages" permission. This is purely so it can notify you of direct messages. Unfortunately, Twitters new permissions model (as of ~June 2011) does not have an option to Read tweets (including direct messages) without also allowing the app to Write (eg Post tweets). So while WristTweet must request this permission, it will never post a tweet or mess with your follower list.
